title: My Lab Journal
text: This is my Lab Journal for Causal Data Science For Business Analytics.

title: My Lab Journal
text:
How to use

Accept the assignment and get your own github repo.
Blog/journal what you are doing in R, by editing the .qmd files.
See the links page for lots of helpful links on learning R.
Change everything to make it your own.clear
Make sure to render you website every time before you want to upload changes.

title: MyLabJournal
text:
#1question random_vars <- readRDS(“random_vars.rds”)
view(random_vars)
expected_value <- colMeans(random_vars) variance <- apply(random_vars, 2, var) standard_deviation <- sqrt(variance)
cat(“Expected Value:”, expected_value, “”) cat(“Variance:”, variance, “”) cat(“Standard Deviation:”, standard_deviation, “”)
#2question It make sense beacause standard deviation gives us the distribution of data that how disperse or spreaded the data is.
#3question
cov <- cov(random_vars) cor <- cor(random_vars)
cat(“Covariance Matrix:”, cov, “”) cat(“Correlation Matrix:”, cor, “”)
here the correlation represents that its in high in magnitute so which indicates stronger linear relationship between age and income and covarince indicates the measure of linear dependancy of age and income
#4question Correlation is a standardized measure that ranges from -1 to 1, it makes easier to compare the strength and direction of the relationship between variables.
#5question
conditional_mean_age_18 <- mean(random_vars\(income[random_vars\)age <= 18]) conditional_mean_age_18_65 <- mean(random_vars\(income[random_vars\)age > 18 & random_vars\(age < 65]) conditional_mean_age_65 <- mean(random_vars\)income[random_vars$age >= 65])
cat(“Conditional Expected Value (Age <= 18):”, conditional_mean_age_18, “”) cat(“Conditional Expected Value (18 < Age < 65):”, conditional_mean_age_18_65, “”) cat(“Conditional Expected Value (Age >= 65):”, conditional_mean_age_65, “”)

title: Causality
text:
Note



You can delete everything in here and start fresh.


library(ggplot2)
set.seed(223)
variable1 <- rnorm(200) variable2 <- variable1 + rnorm(200)
df <- data.frame(Variable1 = variable1, Variable2 = variable2)
ggplot(df, aes(x = Variable1, y = Variable2)) + geom_point() + labs(title = “Spurious Correlation Example”, x = “Variable 1”, y = “Variable 2”) + theme_minimal()
data(mtcars)
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(cyl))) + geom_bar() + labs(title = “Bar Graph of Number of Cylinders”, x = “Number of Cylinders”, y = “Count”) + theme_minimal()

title: MyLabJournal
text:
dag <- dagitty(’ dag { Encouragement -> UseNewFeature Encouragement -> TimeSpent UserActivity -> UseNewFeature UserActivity -> TimeSpent Unobserved -> UseNewFeature Unobserved -> TimeSpent } ’)
plot(dag)
data <- readRDS(“rand_enc.rds”)
naive_model <- lm(time_spent ~ used_ftr, data = data) naive_estimate <- coef(naive_model)[“used_ftr”]
library(AER)
iv_model <- ivreg(time_spent ~ used_ftr | rand_enc, data = data) iv_estimate <- coef(iv_model)[“used_ftr”]
cat(“Naive Estimate:”, naive_estimate, “”) cat(“IV Estimate:”, iv_estimate, “”)

title: MyLabJournal
text:
data <- readRDS(“membership.rds”)
dag <- dagitty(“dag { age -> avg_purch sex -> avg_purch pre_avg_purch -> avg_purch card -> avg_purch }”)
plot(dag)
naive_ate <- mean(data\(avg_purch[data\)card == 1]) - mean(data\(avg_purch[data\)card == 0])
exact_match <- matchit(card ~ age + sex + pre_avg_purch, data = data, method = “cem”)
nn_match <- matchit(card ~ age + sex + pre_avg_purch, data = data, method = “nearest”)
ipw_model <- twang(treatment = data\(card,  x = cbind(data\)age, data\(sex, data\)pre_avg_purch), y = data$avg_purch)
exact_match_ate <- lm(avg_purch ~ card, data = match.data(exact_match))
nn_match_ate <- lm(avg_purch ~ card, data = match.data(nn_match))
ipw_ate <- lm(avg_purch ~ card, weights = ipw_model$weights, data = data)
cat(“Naive ATE:”, naive_ate) cat(“Coarsened Exact Matching ATE:”, coef(exact_match_ate)[2]) cat(“Nearest-Neighbor Matching ATE:”, coef(nn_match_ate)[2]) cat(“Inverse Probability Weighting ATE:”, coef(ipw_ate)[2])

title: MyLabJournal
text:
library(dagitty)
dag <- dagitty(‘dag { ParkingSpots -> Location ParkingSpots -> Sales Location -> Sales }’)
plot(dag)
customer_sat<- readRDS(“customer_sat.rds”)
model_1 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = customer_data) summary(model_1)
model_2 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = customer_data) summary(model_2)
coefficients_comparison <- data.frame( Model1 = coef(model_1), Model2 = coef(model_2) ) print(coefficients_comparison)
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(customer_sat, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction,)) + geom_point(shape = 16) +
labs(x = “Follow-up Calls”, y = “Satisfaction”, title = “Scatter Plot: Follow-up Calls vs Satisfaction”) + geom_smooth(method = “lm”, se = FALSE, color = “red”)

title: MyLabJournal
text:
library(tidyverse) library(broom) library(ggplot2)
abtest_data <- readRDS(“abtest_online.rds”)
str(abtest_data)
ggplot(abtest_data, aes(x = chatbot, y = previous_visits)) + geom_boxplot() + labs(title = “Balance Check: Covariates Across Groups”, x = “Chatbot”, y = “Previous Visits”)
reg_model <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot + mobile_device + previous_visits, data = abtest_data)
summary(reg_model)
reg_interaction_model <- lm(purchase_amount ~ chatbot * mobile_device + previous_visits, data = abtest_data)
summary(reg_interaction_model)
ggplot(abtest_data, aes(x = chatbot, y = purchase_amount, color = mobile_device)) + geom_boxplot() + labs(title = “Interaction Effect: Chatbot and Purchase Amount for Mobile Users”, x = “Chatbot”, y = “Purchase Amount”)
logistic_model <- glm(purchase ~ chatbot + mobile_device + previous_visits, family = binomial(link = ‘logit’), data = abtest_data)
summary(logistic_model)

title: MyLabJournal
text:
data <- readRDS(“hospdd.rds”)
before_treated_mean <- mean(filter(data, procedure == “new”, month == “before”)\(satis) after_treated_mean <- mean(filter(data, procedure == "new", month == "after")\)satis) before_control_mean <- mean(filter(data, procedure == “old”, month == “before”)\(satis) after_control_mean <- mean(filter(data, procedure == "old", month == "after")\)satis)
diff_treated <- after_treated_mean - before_treated_mean diff_control <- after_control_mean - before_control_mean
diff_in_diff_estimate <- diff_treated - diff_control
reg_model <- lm(satis ~ procedure * month + hospital, data = data)
coefficients <- summary(reg_model)$coefficients
diff_in_diff_estimate_regression <- coefficients[“procedure1:month4”, “Estimate”]

title: MyLabJournal
text:
#assingment 1 prob_tree<- function() { prob_dic<- c(“p_T”=0.3,“p_NT”=0.7) p_T<-0.3 #probability of on time p_NT<-0.7 #probability of not on time p_S<-0.6 #probability of on scope in change p_NS<-0.4 #probability of on no cope in change
p_S_by_T<-0.2 #p(S | T) p_NS_by_T<-0.8 #p(NS | T) p_NS_by_NT<-0.4 #p(NS | NT) p_S_by_NT<-0.6 #p(S | NT)
p_T_and_S <- p_S_by_T * p_T #p(T and S)
p_T_and_NS <- p_NS_by_T * p_T #p(T and NS) p_NT_and_S <- p_S_by_NT * p_NT #p(NT and S) p_NT_and_NS <- p_NS_by_NT * p_NT #p(NT and NS)
final_prob<- c( p_T_and_S, p_T_and_NS, p_NT_and_S, p_NT_and_NS)
print(final_prob)
sum_prob<- sum(final_prob) print(sum_prob)
#assingment 2 anwers:
p_s<-589 #smartphones users p_t<-389 #tablet users p_c<-226 #camputer users
p_s_u_t <- 73 #smartphones and tablet users p_s_u_c <- 88 #smartphones and computer users p_t_u_c <- 33 #tablet and computer users
p_s_u_t_u_c <- 5 #all device users
all_users<-(p_s + p_t + p_c)
ans1 <- (p_s_u_t_u_c/ all_users) * 100 ans1
ans2<- ((p_s_u_t_u_c + p_s_u_t + p_s_u_c + p_t_u_c)/ all_users) * 100 ans2
ans3 <- ((p_s - (p_s_u_t + p_s_u_c + p_s_u_t_u_c)) + (p_t - (p_s_u_t + p_t_u_c + p_s_u_t_u_c)) + (p_c - (p_t_u_c + p_s_u_c + p_s_u_t_u_c)))/ all_users * 100 ans3
#assingment3 ans; p(’A|B) = 0.19 p(A|B) = 0.80
}

title: MyLabJournal
text:
library(tidyverse)
car_prices<- readRDS(“car_prices.rds”)
dim(car_prices)
str(car_prices)
summary(car_prices)
lm_model <- lm(price ~ ., data = car_prices)
summary(lm_model)
regressor <- car_prices$horsepower
typeof(regressor) unique(regressor)
coef_table <- coef(lm_model) effect_on_price <- coef_table[“horsepower”]
p_value <- lm_model$Coefficients[“horsepower”, “Pr(>|t|)”]
cat(“Regressor (horsepower) data type:”, typeof(regressor)) cat(“Regressor (horsepower) values:”, unique(regressor)) cat(“Effect on price:”, effect_on_price) cat(“Statistical significance (p-value):”, p_value)
car_prices_with_seat_heating <- car_prices %>% mutate(seat_heating = TRUE)
lm_model_with_seat_heating <- lm(price ~ ., data = car_prices_with_seat_heating)
summary(lm_model_with_seat_heating)

title: MyLabJournal
text:
library(rdd)
data <- readRDS(“coupon.rds”)
running_variable <- data\(days_since_last_centered outcome_variable <- data\)purchase_after threshold <- 0 # Replace with your actual threshold value
original_bandwidth <- 0.1 # Replace with your original bandwidth value
rdd_result_original <- rdd(data, y = outcome_variable, x = running_variable, cutpoint = threshold, h = original_bandwidth)
half_bandwidth <- original_bandwidth / 2 double_bandwidth <- original_bandwidth * 2
rdd_result_half <- rdd(data, y = outcome_variable, x = running_variable, cutpoint = threshold, h = half_bandwidth)
rdd_result_double <- rdd(data, y = outcome_variable, x = running_variable, cutpoint = threshold, h = double_bandwidth)
summary(rdd_result_original) summary(rdd_result_half) summary(rdd_result_double)
library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)
shipping_data <- readRDS(“shipping.rds”)
ggplot(shipping_data, aes(x = purchase_amount, y = outcome_variable)) + geom_point() + geom_vline(xintercept = 30, linetype = “dashed”, color = “red”) + labs(title = “Relationship between Purchase Amount and Outcome Variable”, x = “Purchase Amount”, y = “Outcome Variable”) + theme_minimal()
